remarks: Lemma for ~ cantnf .  This part of the proof is showing uniqueness of the Cantor normal form.  We already know that the relation ` T ` is a strict order, but we haven't shown it is a well-order yet.  But being a strict order is enough to show that two distinct ` F , G ` are ` T ` -related as ` F < G ` or ` G < F ` , and WLOG assuming that ` F < G ` , we show that ` CNF ` respects this order and maps these two to different ordinals.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 28-May-2015.)  (Revised by AV, 2-Jul-2019.)
